events.name: Kx Community December Meetup
events.description: Hi All, We are pleased to invite you to our next Kx Community Singapore Meetup.  The Meetup will be held upstairs in The Penny Black on Boat Quay.  Date: Tuesday, December 8th 2015 Venue: Penny Black, Level 1, Boat Quay, Singapore Time: 6:30pm- 8:30pm Agenda: Agenda to follow How to Register: To secure your place, please register your interest to [masked]by Friday, December 4th.  Feel free to forward to your colleagues or associates that may be interested.Please also visit our Meetup website and become a member http://www.meetup.com/kx-sgp We hope you can join us!

events.name: Dec/2015 - Open Space (habits)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Sergey Open Space Theme: Habits Habits and rituals are the root of consistent behavior – good or bad. Establishing good habits can help you and your organization ensure positive behavior. Replacing bad habits can turn the downward trend upwards. Let's talk about useful habits, dangerous habits, analyzing habits, introducing habits, replacing habits and talking about habits in organizations. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 9:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) This is a shorter than usual evening, we'll only have two sessions and finish by 9pm. What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: PyLadies: Python 101 Workshop
events.description:
It's happening! After more than four months of growing this community and covering many topics around how to setup Python and how to use GitHub, we will finally do a real Python coding workshop.

Like all the other workshops, this workshop is suitable for total programming beginners, you don't need to know anything!

It is very hands-on, so please install Python 2.7, the free atom.io editor and bring your laptop.

We will learn about the basic Python syntax, like variables, strings, lists, dictionaries, if-statements, loops, functions and classes. If all this sounds scary to you, then YOU NEED TO COME AND SEE THIS!

This time it will not be at the PayPal office, but at the RedHat office, nearest MRT is Tanjong Pagar. It's at Level 10. Softdrinks and Pizza will be provided.

We have room for about 20 pax, so please, if you RSVP but later you realize that you can't make it, switch it back to "I'm interested".
events.location: Red Hat Asia Pacific Pte Ltd, 8 Shenton Way, Axa Tower, Singapore 068811 Level 10

events.name: An evening of discovery through photography - the camera, you and the stories
events.description:
Visual Storytelling
by Preetam Rai

Photo stories are great when it comes to engage or educate your audience. Join us to explore visual storytelling platforms such as Exposure, Lift, Sway and VSCO.

===========================================

Take on the World with your Camera
by Lynus Hee

In this session, Adobe Photoshop Expert, Lynus Hee will be sharing travel photography tips when it comes to planning for overseas photography adventures. From what websites to visit, free apps that you can download to what to pack for different types of photography tips. Lynus has more than than 10 years of photography experiences and has organized photography trips such as to Norway to film the Aurora Borealis,Arizona lightning tours and more recently storm chasing trips in Colorado.

===========================================

Instagram Workshop: How To Put Your Best Self Forward on Instagram 
by Katy Rosli

Katy will first touch on the basic common rules in photography.
Participants will learn how to take selfies, food pics, landscape shots and many more. Participants will also get to learn how to edit photos, use the right angles and grids, choose the best filters, as well as frame and compose your shots. Android and IOS phones are both welcome.

By the end of the 30 minutes workshop, participants will get to try it on their own. They do not need to have any prior photography skills. All you need is to have a working smartphone with the apps installed onto your mobile device before coming to the session.
- Instagram (iOS and Andriod app available)
- VSCO (iOS and Android app available)

Do check out Katy Rosli’s VSCO for her works.

REGISTER HERE
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-dec-meeting-2015-tickets-19775373675
